attributes.action: state unequivocally that the Government respects the civil rights of individuals, and so will not seek to give 'Stop and quiz' powers to the police.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Home Office would apparently like police to have greater freedom to stop and question anyone in the UK. This is a threat to our civil liberties.

It has also been reported, by the BBC, that the Prime Minister believes that to put civil liberties before fighting terror is "misguided and wrong". 

If we allow him to surrender our liberties because of terror, we will have surrendered them to terror.

Please, if you care for your civil rights, forward this e-petition to like-minded friends, and ensure that no law-abiding person in Britain has reason to fear the knock on the door or the tap on the shoulder. The Government may have misrepresented its aim - if that is the case, the Prime Minister should say so.
